findings.title: Minter Can Be Permanently Locked Out of mint() Function
findings.description: A minter can be permanently locked out of the mint() function if they provide a large enough nonce value, causing their _data.to address to become permanently locked out of minting any new NFTs.

findings.title: OpenCampusMinter.sol: Function setOpenCampusWalletAddress() does not validate the provided wallet address
findings.description: The function `setOpenCampusWalletAddress()` does not validate the provided `_openCampusWalletAddress`, which can potentially lead to the `mint()` function unexpectedly reverting.

findings.title: Lockable.sol: Once locked, minting can no longer be unlocked
findings.description: Once minting is locked using the function `lockMint()`, there is no way to reverse this behavior by re-enabling minting once again.

findings.title: Functions pause(), unpause() and mint() do not emit events
findings.description: The functions pause(), unpause() and mint() do not emit events, making it difficult for protocol participants to detect when the contracts have been paused/unpaused or an NFT has been minted.

findings.title: Hardcoding the IPFS URI limits contract reusability
findings.description: Hardcoding the IPFS URI passed to the ERC1155() constructor can potentially limit future reusability of the OpenCampusGenesis contract.

findings.title: OpenCampusMinter.sol: Redundant import of the String library
findings.description: The contract OpenCampusMinter.sol has a redundant import of the String library.
